detailed_results.reasoning: The prediction omits parentheses around the conjunction, which changes the scope of the temporal operator. In ATL, <<Robot2>> X attack && !defend is parsed as (<<Robot2>> X attack) && !defend, meaning the robot can ensure attack in the next step, but the lack of defense is a separate, non-strategic requirement. The gold formula <<Robot2>> X (attack && !defend) correctly requires the robot to ensure both attack and not defend simultaneously in the next step. This is a semantic difference in the expressed property.
